critique: The executive order seems to aim for a tone of serious resolve and determination in the face of a public health crisis (Ebola outbreak). It invokes constitutional authority and authorizes the Secretary of Defense and Homeland Security to augment the armed forces. The order does not want to invoke joy. It may want to invoke a bit of surprise that the president is augmenting the armed forces. It may want to invoke a bit of fear to show the seriousness of the situation. It may want to invoke a bit of sadness to show the seriousness of the situation. It does not want to invoke disgust or anger.
